result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both Operating w/ PAC 9th and OWI (7th, 8th or 9th). The defendant was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC 9th and the other charge, OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Randolph G Penkert was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC 9th, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Pay the costs of supervision.

Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.

Not to operate any motor vehicle without an IID installed.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the agent.  Comply with recommendations for therapy or treatment of his agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with extended supervision conditions.

Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.

Court will allow his agent access to the sentencing report of Andreas Associates if he/she desires.  

Defendant to be subject to random testing by his agent.

supervisions.notes: Per Statute 343.301(g) your operating privileges for operation of Class D vehicles will require that vehicles owned and/or driven by you be equipped with an ignition interlock device.  Must install a mandatory Ignition Interlock Device when defendant obtains an occupational license or regular license.  There is a $50 ignition interlock surcharge imposed.

ADDRESS INFO for Randolph G Penkert
Current: W6898 E. Staffon Road, C/O Black River Correctional Center, Black River Falls, WI 54615 United States  (Effective: 12-19-2016)
Prior: 311 Armstrong Ave, Black River Falls, WI 54615
For Half-Priced Ignition Interlock Device  (Sent to Judge with Proposed Order on 12-19)
of 2/29/16 plea/sentencing hearing.
from Attorney Cohen
Associated with Charge #2
DNA submission form.

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, with Attorney Cohen.  Plead guilty to Count 2.  Court advised the defendant of the possible penalties of the charge he plead to.  He understood.  Priors confirmed by the court.  Defense acknowledged the priors are all valid.   Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Defendant understood.  Felony warnings given.  Defendant understood.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the pleas. Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently entered his pleas and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the pleas.  Found guilty of Count 2.  Count 1 dismissed by operation of law.  Tracking citations to be dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes.  State recommended statutory minimum penalties.  Eligible for ERP and SAP.  6 years total.  3 years initial confinement, 3 years extended supervision.    Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.    Defendant must submit to testing for alcohol when requested by any law enforcement officer or his agent.   Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without IID installed.   DL revocation & IID,  2 years.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with extended supervision conditions.  Credit for 3 days.  Attorney Cohen called L. A., sworn.  Testified regarding sentencing recommendation.  DA Fox questioned the witness.  Defense redirect.  No recross.  Defense recommends community supervision.  Impose and stay prison sentence.  1 year jail.  5 years probation.  Defendant exercised his right to allocution.  

Court ordered:  6 years total.  3 years initial confinement, 3 years extended supervision.    Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.    Defendant shall not operate any motor vehicle without IID installed.   DL revocation & IID,  2 years.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with extended supervision conditions.  CC, DNA sample and surcharge.  Pay the costs of supervision.  Subject to random testing by his agent.  Not eligible for CIP.  Eligible for SAP.  Alc assmt & DSP.  3 days credit.  Comply with recommendation for therapy or treatment of his agent.  If DOC wishes to access the sentencing report of Andreas Associates, court will allow.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 02-29-2016 10:00 am
Defense sentencing report.

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Cohen.  Independent pre-sentence report filed with the court.  Reschedule plea/sentencing to 2/29/16 at 10:00 am. 1 hour.
Plea hearing at 01-25-2016 01:30 pm
Held in chambers.  No court reporter.  DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Attorney Cohen appeared by telephone.  Plea set for 1/25/16 at 1:30 pm.  Bond continued.
Status conference at 10-14-2015 08:30 am

Defendant appeared with counsel Michael Cohen.  Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Attorney Cohen states his argument for his motion.  DA Fox states there is a mandatory minimum confinement required for OWI 7th of 3 years.  Attorney Cohen states he is not challenging the constitutionality, he's challenging the penalities that apply in this case and their application to his client.  Court takes notice the Motion has been filed; will make part of the record as attorney Cohen allowed to make efforts to preserve for appeal.  Court set status conference for 10-14 at 8:30.  Attorney Cohen will call in and will be heard in Chambers.  City citations are to continue to track with criminal case.
Motion hearing at 09-15-2015 03:30 pm

Status conference at 06-15-2015 03:00 pm

DA Fox appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Jessie Weber.  Reading of amended information waived.  NGP entered.  Defense will be filing motion and brief.  Court ordered motion to be filed by 5/31/15, and for defense to schedule a motion hearing.
Information filed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of the information.  DA Fox advises court and defense he will be filing an amended information.

DA Fox appears on behalf of the State.  Defendant appears in person and with Attorney Cohen.  Court questions defendant on his understanding of the waiver of the preliminary hearing.  Defendant understands.  Court finds defendant has freely, knowingly and intelligently waived his right to preliminary hearing.  Court finds probable cause.
and certificate of appearance served on Officer Dean R. Taylor to appear at preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing on February 26, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Defendant appeared in person and counsel Michael Cohen appeared by phone.  Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Will be set for preliminary hearing.  TR's still tracking.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: and certificate of appearance served on Dean Taylor to appear at preliminary hearing on 10/6/14

Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on the highways until properly reinstated in the State of Wisconsin.
